DataElement.preferredName: Additional Targeted Therapy Recurrence Cancer Progression Agent Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to identify additional targeted molecular therapy agent administered to an individual with recurrent or progressive disease. [Manually-curated]

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Additional Targeted Therapy Recurrence Cancer Progression Therapy
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Cancer therapies which use drugs to act upon specific molecules, metabolic pathways or processes involved in carcinogenesis, tumor growth, or tumor spread._Added; extra; further._To occur again._The worsening of a cancer over time._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):The process of directing an agent to a specific anatomic location.

Concepts.definition: The process of directing an agent to a specific anatomic location.

Property.preferredDefinition: To occur again.:The worsening of a cancer over time.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: update for compliance for use on new CDE

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the name of the agent or drug that has been administered to the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI):The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
